Dear David,

We added Cantera to the International Curriculum on Hydrogen S=
afety 
Engineering (http://www.hysafe.org/index.php?ID=3D68) and our studen=
ts 
are using it to make their coursework (see Problem 3 of Part 2 at:
http=
://www.engj.ulst.ac.uk/esshs/pgchse/Coursework/PrinciplesOfHydrog
enSafety_=
CourseWork_1.pdf). 

But now our students are reporting trouble with versio=
n 1.7.0. Would 
it be possible for you to reply to these questions so that =
I can 
forward it to the students. Also, my colleague Matheusz uninstalled =

1.7.0 and re-installed 1.5.5; version 1.5.5 runs properly on his 
machine.=
 What is different in 1.7.0 that it does not run as smooth 
as 1.5.5?

Belo=
w are the messages of our students. I copied them as they are.

With best r=
egards,
Arief Dahoe

Subject: Re:Problem with Can=
tera installation  Topic: Assignment 1  
Author: Arief Dahoe  Date: 15 Marc=
h 2007 10:58
 

Dear Georges,

On my computer the .pyw files are in:

C:\Do=
cuments and Settings\Prometheus\Local Settings\Temp

In the error message y=
ou posted there is:

python C:\DOCUME~1\GEORGE~2\LOCALS~1\Temp/.cttmp117385=
3299.pyw> 
ct2ctml.log 2>&1

Now, in the part
"\LOCALS~1\Temp/.cttmp1173853=
299.pyw"
there is a forward slash "/" whereas direcrories are separated by =

the backslash "\" in Windows. Could this be the cause of the error 
you ob=
served?

Arief
